movies.title: Arrêtez-moi
movies.plot: Un soir, une femme se rend dans un commissariat pour confesser le meurtre de son mari violent, commis il y a plusieurs années...  »
movies.simplePlot: Un soir, une femme se rend dans un commissariat pour confesser le meurtre de son mari violent, commis il y a plusieurs années...

biography.bio: Sophie Marceau was born Sophie Danièle Sylvie Maupu in Paris, France, to Simone (Morisset), a shop assistant, and Benoît Maupu, a truck driver. She grew up far from the studio spotlights. When she was 14 she was living in the Paris suburb of Gentilly with her father. She learned from friends that director Claude Pinoteau was looking for new faces for a movie about teenagers called The Party (1980). She auditioned for the role, got it, and the film was a success. She played in La boum 2 (1982), then bought back her contract with Gaumont when she was 16 years old for one million French francs. She is a critically acclaimed actress, having received the Cesar for Best Feminine Hope for "La Boum 2" in 1983. She was elected Romantic actress for Chouans! (1988) at the Festival International du Film Romantique (International Festival of Romantic Movie) of Cabourg in 1988, and was awarded the Moliere of the Best Theatrical Revelation for "Eurydice et Pygmalion" in 1994.
biography.name: Sophie Marceau

biography.bio: Miou-Miou was born Sylvette Herry on February 22, 1950, in Paris, France. Her father was a gendarme, her mother was a sales-woman. Young Miou-Miou was selling strawberries helping out at her mother's fruit and vegetable stand at a street market. There she was spotted by actor-director Romain Bouteille, who invited her to work at Cafe de la Gare, a popular Parisian theatre, where Gérard Depardieu and Patrick Dewaere were principal actors. There she began as a cleaning lady, then became a dresser, then an actress. She was nicknamed Miou-Miou by Coluche because she was always nice, quiet, and clean as a kitty. In 1971, Miou-Miou made her film debut in La vie sentimentale de Georges le tueur (1971) (The Sentimental Life of George Le Tueur 1971). At that time she became romantically involved with the fellow actor Patrick Dewaere. Their daughter, named Angele, was born in 1974, but their relationship ended few years later, after their work in several films. Their relationship was portrayed in F comme Fairbanks (1976), and later was documented in _Patrick Dewaere (1992 documentary)_. Miou-Miou has been an unusual personality in the French cinema. She once refused to take the Cesar Award for Best Actress, which she won for the title role in Memoirs of a French Whore (1979). She explained that refusal citing her belief that artists should not compete against each other. Her career was hardly affected by such a gesture. She was nominated for Cesar nine times. Her better known works were made with Gérard Depardieu in Going Places (1974), This Sweet Sickness (1977), Ménage (1986), and Germinal (1993), an adaptation of the eponymous novel by Émile Zola.
biography.name: Miou-Miou

biography.bio: Yann Ebonge was born on November 14, 1991 in Paris, France. He is an actor, known for La journée de la jupe (2008), Clandestin (2010) and Arrêtez-moi (2013).
biography.name: Yann Ebonge

biography.bio: Marc Barbé was born on May 6, 1961 in Nancy, Meurthe-et-Moselle, Lorraine, France. He is an actor and director, known for La Vie en Rose (2007), Sombre (1998) and Nannerl, la soeur de Mozart (2010).
biography.name: Marc Barbé

biography.bio: Valérie Bodson is an actress, known for JCVD (2008), The Little Bedroom (2010) and Arrêtez-moi (2013).
biography.name: Valérie Bodson

biography.bio: Arthur Buyssens is an actor, known for Ineffaçable (2015), Solo Rex (2014) and Arrêtez-moi (2013).
biography.name: Arthur Buyssens

biography.bio: Vadim Goudsmits is an actor, known for Arrêtez-moi (2013).
biography.name: Vadim Goudsmits

biography.bio: Claudine Pelletier is an actress, known for Mobile Home (2012), The Little Bedroom (2010) and La vie est belge (2014).
biography.name: Claudine Pelletier

biography.bio: Jenny Clève was born on April 3, 1930 in Roubaix, France. She is an actress, known for One Deadly Summer (1983), Bienvenue chez les Ch'tis (2008) and The Children of the Marshland (1999). She was previously married to Claude Talpaert.
biography.name: Jenny Clève

biography.bio: Roger De Moerloose is an actor, known for Arrêtez-moi (2013), Une place sur la Terre (2013) and La fugue de Suzanne (1974).
biography.name: Roger De Moerloose

biography.placeOfBirth: Leningrad, Russian SFSR, USSR [now St. Petersburg, Russia]
biography.bio: Was born in St Petersburg, Russia. 21 years old but already an experienced actress. Played in 10 films or telefilms in Russia and more recently in France. First film "Freeze, Die, Come to life" was awarded Gold Camera at Le Festival de Cannes. Lives now half in St Petersbourg, half in Paris. Dramatically charming girl.
biography.name: Dinara Drukarova

biography.bio: Serge Hollogne is an actor, known for Last Love (2013), Arrêtez-moi (2013) and Otages (2009).
biography.name: Serge Hollogne

biography.bio: Eric Godon was born on February 7, 1959 in Baudour, Belgium. He is known for his work on In Bruges (2008), Legends (2014) and The Halcyon (2017).
biography.name: Eric Godon

biography.bio: Frédéric Frenay is an actor, known for Tango libre (2012), Diamant 13 (2009) and Ne te retourne pas (2009).
biography.name: Frédéric Frenay

biography.bio: Patrick Hastert is an actor, known for Shadow of the Vampire (2000), Hannah Arendt (2012) and Twin Sisters (2002).
biography.name: Patrick Hastert
